page.title: 14VILLAGE CHANGES SINCE 1900
page.content: outside the British Isles. 2a.From 100 households 123 people are in full-time employment. 2b.There are 40 retired people living in these homes. 2c.As a contrast from the types of employment at the beginning of this century,only 11% are employed locally in some kind of {FARMING,}yet 36% are engaged in{PROFESSIONAL OCCUPATIONS.} Apart from farming all other kinds of work is undertaken away from the local villages. 3a.Numbers in each houselold holding { {DRIVING LICENCES.}Two homes have four driving licence holders.Ten have three,sixty-seven have two,seventeen homes have one and four homes have no-one holding a driving licence. 3b.Number of cars per house.One home has five cars,four have three, forty-eight have two cars per house,
